channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft says Lumma password stealer malware found on 394,000 Windows PCs
item.description: Microsoft and law enforcement announced a coordinated takedown of the Lumma pasword-stealing malware.

item.title: Anthropic’s New Model Excels at Reasoning and Planning—and Has the Pokémon Skills to Prove It
item.description: When Anthropic's older Claude model played Pokemon Red, it spent “dozens of hours” stuck in one city and had trouble identifying non-player characters...

item.title: Mozilla is shutting down read-it-later app Pocket
item.description: Mozilla announced on Thursday that it’s shutting down Pocket, a read-it-later app it acquired in 2017, on July 8. The company is also shutting down Fa...

item.title: AI Is Eating Data Center Power Demand—and It’s Only Getting Worse
item.description: A new analysis of AI hardware being produced and how it is being used attempts to estimate the vast amount of electricity being consumed by AI.

item.title: A safety institute advised against releasing an early version of Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4 AI model
item.description: A third-party research institute that Anthropic partnered with to test one of its new flagship AI models, Claude Opus 4, recommended against deploying...

item.title: Kesha Wants to ‘Smash’ the Music Industry With a New LinkedIn-Style App
item.description: Ahead of her new album and tour, pop titan Kesha says she wants to start a new platform called Smash that helps artists connect, collaborate, and coll...

item.title: A United Arab Emirates Lab Announces Frontier AI Projects—and a New Outpost in Silicon Valley
item.description: As Donald Trump pens deals in the Middle East, the gulf nation opens a research lab in San Francisco.

item.title: Anthropic’s new AI model turns to blackmail when engineers try to take it offline
item.description: Anthropic’s newly launched Claude Opus 4 model frequently tries to blackmail developers when they threaten to replace it with a new AI system and give...

item.title: DOGE Used a Meta AI Model to Review Emails From Federal Workers
item.description: DOGE tested and used Meta’s Llama 2 model to review and classify responses from federal workers to the infamous “Fork in the Road” email.

item.title: Open social web browser Surf makes it easier for anyone to build custom feeds
